sentence.idiomatic: Do you like to drink draft beer?
Waiter, one glass of draft beer, please.
I think that draft beer tastes better than bottled beer.
I like to drink bottled milk, and I don't like to drink milk from a bag.
Do you wanted to buy beer in bottles or cans?
Drinking bottled water is bad for the environment.
Now the quality of domestically manufactured cell phones is pretty good, too.
The TV I bought is a domestic brand.
This medicine is imported, not domestically produced.
Let's take a look at the drink list first.
Drink prices are all on the drink list.
Why is this drink's price higher than its price on the drink list?
Would you like to eat imported fruit?
Import cars are too expensive, so you still ought to buy a domestic one.
This type of toy is imported and can't be bought elsewhere.
I heard that that shopping center was going to have a sales promotion tomorrow. Are you going?
Recently there have been promotions for many notebook computers.
When will you have a promotion?
He can't drink a bottle of baijiu by himself.
Can you drink all of this water? If not, don't try to drink it all.
If you can't finish this bottle of milk then put it in the refrigerator.
100 RMB for a single watermelon, are you trying to rob me?
This restaurant is simply robbing people by charging 200 RMB for a single cup of tea.
These clothes are worth 50 RMB at most. Trying to charge me 500 RMB for them is simply robbery.
What beer do you have here?
We have draft beer fresh off the tap. Do you want to try it?
How much for a glass?
What bottled beer do you have?
A lot. We've got European, American, Japanese, and Chinese beers.
Could you let me have a look at the drink list?
Sure.
How come they're so expensive?
Oh, these are all imports.
Are there any promotions?
None for beer. There are for whiskey. You want a bottle?
It's just me. I can't drink a whole bottle of whiskey. Just give me a bottle of Tsingtao. Cold.
No problem. Here you go.
Huh? 40 RMB for this small of a bottle?
Right. Bars all carry this size.
You guys are robbing me here.
